thread.title: Alcovy/Eastside fight on; Newton season ends
thread.title_full: Alcovy/Eastside fight on; Newton season ends

author: Shakeem Holloway
title: Alcovy/Eastside fight on; Newton season ends
text:
Home › SPORTS › Alcovy/Eastside fight on; Newton season ends Updated: October 14, 2015 9:41 p.m. Alcovy/Eastside fight on; Newton season ends CovNews Comments You must be logged in to post comments. http://beta.covnews.com/ encourages readers to interact with one another. We will not edit your comments, but we reserve the right to delete any inappropriate responses. To report offensive or inappropriate comments, contact our editor . The comments below are from readers of http://beta.covnews.com/ and do not necessarily represent the views of The Covington News or Morris Multimedia. 
Alcovy and Eastside both swept the competition on Wednesday evening to keep their respective championship hopes alive and move on to the second round while Newton dropped two to Newnan, ending the Lady Rams season. 
Alcovy dominated Westlake on Wednesday, as the Lady Tigers won both games by mercy-rule. The first game Alcovy won 9-1 after five innings and the second game ended after four innings with the Lady Tigers winning 19-4. 
Eastside traveled down to Cook County and upset the No. 3 seeded Lady Hornets winning 7-2 and 5-4 to continue the Lady Eagles journey for a state championship. 
Newton hosted Newnan in a two/three seed matchup and the Lady Rams were blown out twice, losing 13-0 and 12-4, knocking them out of the playoffs. 
For full stories on each game, check back at covnews.com and make sure to read Sunday’s print edition of The Covington News. Most Popular Articles
